abstract: For Brazil’s investment bankers, the planned sale of some $82 billion of stock by the oil giant Petrobras could make or break the league tables, but the honor won’t include a big payday, Breakingviews says.
snippet: For Brazil’s investment bankers, the planned sale of some $82 billion of stock by the oil giant Petrobras could make or break the league tables, but the honor won’t include a big payday, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: Brazil promises to be a yearlong carnival for investment bankers. The planned sale of some $82 billion of stock by the oil giant Petrobras could make or break the global underwriting rankings banks use to hawk their services. But, Breakingviews says, the honor won’t include a big payday.

headline.main: For Brazil’s Bankers, Little Payday in Petrobas?

abstract: Surprisingly, in last week’s hearings conducted by the Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission into whether A.I.G. may have been misled by Goldman Sachs into insuring flawed mortgage deals, there was a seriousness of purpose that has been lacking in most of the hearings that have tackled the financial crisis.

lead_paragraph: From The New York Times’s Joe Nocera, writing in his latest Talking Business column:

headline.main: Nocera: Hearings That Aren’t Just Theater

abstract: A Bank of America board member wanted an outsider to take over as chief executive in December, but eventually gave in to backing Brian T. Moynihan for the post, according to a report in The Wall Street Journal.
snippet: A Bank of America board member wanted an outsider to take over as chief executive in December, but eventually gave in to backing Brian T. Moynihan for the post, according to a report in The Wall Street Journal.
lead_paragraph: A Bank of America board member wanted an outsider to take over as chief executive in December, but eventually gave in to backing Brian T. Moynihan for the post, according to a report in The Wall Street Journal.

headline.main: BofA Director Wanted Outsider for C.E.O.

abstract: Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Tuesday that it has hired Mark Rosen from Credit Suisse to head the Latin America financial institutions group in its investment bank.
snippet: Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Tuesday that it has hired Mark Rosen from Credit Suisse to head the Latin America financial institutions group in its investment bank.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Tuesday that it has hired Mark Rosen from Credit Suisse to head the Latin America financial institutions group in its investment bank.

headline.main: BofA Merrill to Hire Latin America Banking Executive
